meanings.sent1: I will prewarn you about the storm coming tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will prewarn the students about the upcoming test.
meanings.sent3: He decided to prewarn his friends about the surprise party to avoid spoiling the surprise.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds prewarned us of the impending rainstorm.
meanings.sent5: The loud thunder prewarned us of the approaching storm.

meanings.definition: To give advance notice or warning.
meanings.sent1: The lifeguard will prewarn the swimmers about the strong currents.
meanings.sent2: Please prewarn me if you plan to arrive late to the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The cat prewarned its owner of the approaching visitor by meowing loudly.
meanings.sent4: The sudden drop in temperature prewarned us of the incoming snowstorm.
meanings.sent5: The barking dog prewarned the family of the stranger approaching the house.
